arma

Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Mat

  • public class Mat
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a real-valued dense matrix with double precision. Member functions as well as attributes are similar to the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library (Armadillo) by Conrad Sanderson et al., based on DenseMatrix64F from Peter Abeles' Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML) Version 0.23 from 21.06.2013.

    See also the syntax conversion table.

    If not stated otherwise (marked as non-canonical in case), the provided interfaces is identical to Armadillo (e.g. same ordering of arguments, accepted values, ...). However, this project is based on EJML to provide a pure Java solution, which is why numeric results may slightly differ from the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library.

    Note: Armadillo stores values by column-major-ordering, while EJML stores them by row-major ordering. In order to be similar to Armadillo, all interfaces work as if column-major-ordering is used while converting to row-major ordering internally.

    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann
    See Also:
    Armadillo C++ Algebra Library, Efficient Java Matrix Library

      • Mat

        public Mat(double[][] matrix)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a matrix with the same size as the provided two-dimensional array.

        The array is assumed to have a structure like array[rows][columns].

        Parameters:
        matrix - The array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - All columns must have the same length.

        fillType - The fill type

    • Method Detail

      • at

        public double at(int i,
        int j)
          throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the value of the element at the ith row and jth column.

        Non-canonical: Performs boundary checks. Note: There is no element access provided without boundary checks.

        Parameters:
        i - The row
        j - The column
        Returns:
        The value
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The requested position is out of bound. The matrix is of size ( n_rows, n_cols) but the position was (i, j).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - All position must be non-negative.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - NaN and infinity are not valid element positions.

        Throws:

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The number of elements of the left-hand side operand must match with the right hand side operand, but were b - a + 1 and operand.n_elem.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The positions are out of bound. The vector contains n_elem elements, but the positions are from a to b.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Only binary arithmetic operators and equality are supported.

      • subvec

        public void subvec(int a,
          int b,
          Op operator,
          double operand)
            throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                   java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation on the ath to bth element and overwrites each element with the result.
        Parameters:
        a - The first element position
        b - The last element position
        operator - The operator
        operand - The right-hand side operand
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Must only be invoked for vectors.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The positions are out of bound. The vector contains n_elem elements, but the positions are from a to b.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Only binary arithmetic operators and equality are supported.

      • diag

        public Mat diag(int k)
         throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the kth diagonal of the matrix as a column vector.

        • For k = 0, the main diagonal is returned
        • For k > 0, the kth super-diagonal is returned.
        • For k < 0, the kth sub-diagonal is returned.
        Parameters:
        k - The diagonal position
        Returns:
        The diagonal
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The diagonal is out of bound. The matrix is of size (n_rows, n_cols), but the diagonal position was k.

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The number of elements of the left-hand side operand must match with the right hand side operand, but were n_rows and operand.n_elem.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The position is out of bound. The matrix contains n_elem elements, but the position was n.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Only binary arithmetic operators and equality are supported.

      • each_row

        public void each_row(Mat selection,
            Op operator,
            double operand)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                     java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation per row specified in the selection – a vector of row positions – and overwrites each row with the result.
        Parameters:
        selection - The row positions
        operator - The operator
        operand - The right-hand side operand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The selection must be a vector, but was a (selection.n_rows, selection.n_cols)-matrix.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Each position must be a integer value, but one was selection.at(n).
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The position is out of bound. The matrix contains n_elem elements, but the position was n.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Only binary arithmetic operators and equality are supported.

      • insert_cols

        public void insert_cols(int a,
               int b,
               boolean fillWithZeros)
                 throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Expands the matrix by insertion of a matrix from the ath to bth column.

        The inserted matrix will be filled with 0 (fillWithZeros = true) or uninitialised otherwise.

        Parameters:
        a - The first column position
        b - The last column position
        fillWithZeros - Whether to be filled with 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - The column positions are out of bound. The matrix contains n_cols columns, but the column positions are from a to b.

      • set_size

        public void set_size(int numberOfElements)
        Parameters:
        numberOfElements -

      • set_size

        public void set_size(int numberOfRows,
            int numberOfColumns)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and neither guarantees to reuse the values of the elements, nor their positions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        reshape(int, int, boolean), resize(int)

      • reshape

        public void reshape(int numberOfRows,
           int numberOfColumns)
        Equivalent to reshape(numberOfRows, numberOfColumns, true)
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.

      • reshape

        public void reshape(int numberOfRows,
           int numberOfColumns,
           boolean rowWise)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and guarantees to reuses the values of the elements, but not their positions. The elements of the current matrix are either accessed row-wise (rowWise = true) or column-wise ( rowWise = false), while the new matrix is always filled column-wise.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        rowWise - The access of the elements of the current matrix .
        See Also:
        set_size(int, int), resize(int, int)

      • resize

        public void resize(int numberOfElements)
        Parameters:
        numberOfElements -

      • resize

        public void resize(int numberOfRows,
          int numberOfColumns)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and guarantees to reuses the values of the elements and their positions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        set_size(int, int), reshape(int, int, boolean)

      • updateAttributes

        private void updateAttributes()
        Updates the attributes n_rows, n_cols and n_elem of the matrix. Should be called right after the shape of the matrix is changed.

      • convertToRowMajorOrdering

        int convertToRowMajorOrdering(int n)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the position of an element based on a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix into a row-major-ordered based one, in order to provide interfaces similar to Armadillo's Mat while using EJML's DenseMatrix64F.
        Parameters:
        n - The position based on column-major-ordering.
        Returns:
        The position based on row-major-ordering.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the provided position is out of bound.
